newsitem.title: USA: Frank Sinatra again in a hospital.
newsitem.headline: Frank Sinatra again in a hospital.

text.p: Singer Frank Sinatra, who spent eight days in a hospital last November, was admitted to Cedars-Sinai medical centre on Monday, his publicist said.
Susan Reynolds declined to say why Sinatra, 81, was admitted to the Beverly Hills facility but said he was expected to be released on Tuesday.
She said the famed crooner and movie actor was driven to the hospital in a private car but Sinatra requested no further details be released.
The singer was admitted to Cedars-Sinai in November suffering from a pinched nerve, but stayed there for eight days after developing pneumonia and reportedly suffering a mild heart attack.
In an interview last month his daughter Nancy Sinatra said that when asked what he wanted for Christmas, the singer replied, another Christmas.
